resources.string: No! Controlled Burn is not a replacement for a medical professional and does not provide medical advice. It is meant to be used with proper medical supervision. Discuss your goals and use of Controlled Burn regularly with your physician. Please don\'t sue me.

Controlled Burn uses the data that you provide to estimate the number of calories that you burn every day and the number of calories in each food category. These estimates improve over time with consistent tracking.
Why is the estimated weight different from what the scale tells me?

Your weight can fluctuate quite a bit from day to day and even hour to hour based on hydration, food intake, and bodily functions. Controlled Burn\'s estimate cuts through the noise so you can keep track of what really matters.
How do I decide how to log my food?

Do whatever makes sense to you. Say you had a burger, fries and a shake. One person might call that a large meal. Another person might say that the burger is a small meal, the fries are a regular snack and the shake is two beverages. Another person might track another way. Don\'t worry about getting the \"right\" answer. Over time, Controlled Burn will figure out what you mean.
How do I choose a goal weight?
Ask your physician to help you choose a weight that will put you at a healthy BMI.
Do I need to record exercise?
Not necessarily, but it is recommended if your workouts typically last more than 30 minutes.
How often do I need to weigh myself?
First thing each morning would be best, but as little as three times a week would be okay.
Do I need to log every day?
Nope. The algorithms know exactly what to do when you take a day off, so don\'t worry about it. Not logging isn\'t going to erase those two orders of nachos though!
What do I do if I forgot to log part of a day?
Either guess what you ate the rest of the day or set all of the numbers back to zero and it\'ll pretend like you just took the day off.
How long does it take Controlled Burn to figure me out?
The estimates improve rapidly for about a month and more slowly after that, but there will always be some error. Give Controlled Burn up to a month to learn before trusting it very much.
Can I use another app to estimate my food/exercise calories?

Sure. Just record the numbers from the other app as other food calories and/or other exercise calories. If you don\'t want to see the food categories, select \"Just calories\" for \"Tracking mode\" in settings.
How is my data backed up?

Controlled Burn uses Android\'s auto backup feature. This feature may be enabled or disabled by navigating to \"Backup and Reset\" under system settings. If enabled, your data will typically be backed up once per day while your phone is charging and connected to wifi. Your data will be restored in the case of a reinstall or when you switch to a new phone. You can verify that your data is being backed up by navigating to \"backups\" in the Google Drive app.
How can I send comments or feedback?
For comments or bug reports, send me an email at controlledburnapp@gmail.com.
What do I do if the backup doesn\'t show up under Google Drive?

Make sure that you have enabled automatic backup and restore in your device settings under \"Backup and Reset.\" Try restarting your device and ensuring that it is connected to wifi before charging it overnight.
Just for the curious. These numbers will often be different from the true values even when the app is working properly. Ignore them when deciding how to log food.

Over time, Controlled Burn figures out how you think about food and how your body uses energy. 

The way that you track food will be unique to you. That's okay! 

Tip: If you're having trouble deciding between two categories, log the smaller one plus a small snack.
Careful! This will remove all of your recorded data and cannot be undone. Would you like to continue?
